Key Match Events: Ireland defeated England by five runs via the Duckworth-Lewis method.
Ireland's Josh Little dismissed England captain Jos Buttler and Alex Hales.
Ireland's Fionn Hand knocked over Ben Stokes in the last over of Power Play.
Barry McCarthy induced a top edge of Dawid Malan inside 14 overs.
Liam Livingstone and Mark Wood took three wickets each to bowl out Ireland for 157.
Ireland skipper Andy Balbirnie scored a 47-ball 62, his eighth T20 half ton and first in a T20 World Cup.
Lorcan Tucker supported Balbirnie with 34 runs from 27 balls in an 82-run second wicket partnership.
Ireland's innings was halted once by passing showers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ireland's win opened the doors for Australia as five of the six teams in the group now have two points each.
This was Ireland's maiden win in the second stage of the T20 World Cup.
Ireland's 100 came up in just 68 balls before a freak run-out ended Tucker's innings.
